People talk about it being easy or boring or whatever, but the real thing is that the support role is the most strategic role.  Mid, top, adc, and even jungle (though not as much) are more hack-and-slash.  You hit minions, hit your opponent, and then get out before you die.  (Of course, this is dumbed down for the purpose of a board post.  I play top a decent amount and I know there are strategic choices one has to make.)

But supports, in my opinion, have a different style of play.  The whole game is about prediction, set up, and initiation.  **It's a strategy game for them; they're the tacticians of the team.**  And if one thing goes wrong, there could be dire consequences.

And that's why a lot of people don't like it.  Most of the support game is spent thinking/planning out the next move/fight, not killing the next wave, which is made increasingly difficult when the main way you have to talk to your team is by typing.  The adc doesn't have time to think about whether or not the enemy mid lane is mia or if the support still has exhaust or if their teammate's ultimates are up.  They need to focus on last hitting minions to become the superpower the team needs to take down the enemy, and then go in when the support starts to execute their plan.  **The support should be the one calling the shots**, staying in communication with the adc or jungler, or whoever they're going to be fighting with, checking in with everyone about cool downs and summoner spells and how much more money they need for their next big item.  It's about checking in on the enemy team, seeing how much of a disadvantage they might be at since the enemy draven just got a bunch of money from his passive, or whatever the situation may be.

**It's not just poke and ward**

I saw that someone brought up that supporting is just making sure you get a sightstone.  Wards are for set up/prediction.  If you want a fight to go in your favor, you gotta know there isn't someone sitting nearby.  But that's not exclusive for supports.  Anyone could get sighstone.  In fact, I'd recommend it for the top, mid, and jungle roles.  It provides health, vision, and you can sell it when you finish lane phase or need another slot.  You can never have too much vision.

Look at it like as if league was a board game.  You'll sit there thinking about your next move and then when it's finally your turn to strike you've made sure every little thing goes perfectly.  Otherwise you may have just lost the game.
